column4: What's the difference between a source archive and a tarball?
a tarball is like a zip file (without the compression) and is a *type* of source archive
a .tar.gz is a tarball that has been subjected to gzip compression

neattoast:  Yes, I was wondering why in this question - http://askubuntu.com/questions/25961/how-to-install-a-tar-gz-file#comment28683_25972 - a difference between a source archive and tarball is stressed
